rspStmt.AuthEnty: Digital Archive of Massachusetts Anti-Slavery and Anti-Segregation Petitions

titlStmt.titl: Unpassed Legislation Relating to Indian Affairs; Senate Unpassed Legislation 1850, Docket 13034, SC1/series 592x, Petition of Benjamin Allen

setAvail.collSize: Single petition scanned as one or more 11x17 images.

stdyInfo.abstract:
Petition: Indian guardians

Original: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:FHCL:12208743

Date of creation: 1850-02-01

Petition location: Tisbury

Legislator, committee, or address that the petition was sent to: Committee on claims

Top signatures:

  1. Benjamin Allen

Actions taken on dates: 1850-02-21,1850-02-21

Legislative action: Received in the House on February 21, 1850 and referred to the committee on claims and sent for concurrence and received in the Senate on February 21, 1850 and concurred.

Total signatures: 1

Legislative action summary: Received, referred, sent, received, concurred

Legal voter signatures (males not identified as non-legal): 1

Identifications of signatories: NA

Prayer format was printed vs. manuscript: Manuscript

Additional non-petition or unrelated documents available at archive: additional documents available

Additional archivist notes: John Cattle, Edmund Cattle

Acknowledgements: Supported by the National Endowment for the Humanities (PW-5105612), Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth, Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study at Harvard University, Center for American Political Studies at Harvard University, Institutional Development Initiative at Harvard University, and Harvard University Library.

citation.biblCit: D. Carpenter, N. Topich and G. Griffin. Digital Archive of Massachusetts Anti-Slavery and Anti-Segregation Petitions; Unpassed Legislation Relating to Indian Affairs; Senate Unpassed Legislation 1850, Docket 13034, SC1/series 592x. Massachusetts Archives. Boston, Mass.
